alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 16 at 4:56PM CDT until March 16 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Bryan County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Marshall County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 530 PM CDT. * At 456 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Madill to 4 miles northwest of Kingston, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Madill, Caddo, Silo, Kenefic, Armstrong, Little City, Nida, northeastern Lake Texoma and Oakland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
